intro: Silene cucubalus proles maritima, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and spiny, lobed leaves adapted to withstand salty sea air and strong winds. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along shorelines. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Silene cucubalus proles maritima plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal environments and supporting local biodiversity.
